title: 110_s3714
content: The Derivatives Trading Integrity Act of 2008 is also known as the "Derivatives Trading Integrity Act". It regulates certain agreements, contracts, and transactions. The Commodity Exchange Act is amended to redefine certain sections and exclude others. It restricts futures trading to specific markets or facilities. The Commodity Exchange Act is amended to remove certain subsections and repeal Section 5d regarding exempt Boards of Trade. SEC. 3. CONFORMING AMENDMENTS. Section 1a of the Commodity Exchange Act is amended to remove references to electronic trading facilities and adjust certain subparagraphs. Section 2(c) of the Act is also amended to remove specific references in paragraph 1. Section 4a of the Commodity Exchange Act is amended to remove references to electronic trading facilities and adjust certain subparagraphs. The Commodity Exchange Act's Section 4a is amended to eliminate mentions of electronic trading facilities and modify specific subparagraphs related to significant price discovery contracts. The Commodity Exchange Act is amended to remove references to electronic trading facilities and significant price discovery contracts. The Commodity Exchange Act is amended to remove references to electronic trading facilities and significant price discovery contracts, including changes to subsections (b)(2) and (g) of Section 5a. The Commodity Exchange Act is amended to update references to excluded commodities and exemptions, specifically in sections 5b and 2. The Commodity Exchange Act is amended to update references to excluded commodities and exemptions in sections 5b and 2, including changes to subsections (b) and (h) of the Act. The Commodity Exchange Act is amended to update references to excluded commodities and exemptions in sections 5b and 2, including changes to subsections (b) and (h) of the Act. Section 5e and 5f of the Act are also amended to remove references to electronic trading facilities in certain contexts. Section 5f(b)(1) of the Commodity Exchange Act is amended to replace "section 5f" with "this section." Section 6(b) is amended to remove references to electronic trading facilities. Section 12(e) is amended by replacing paragraph (2) with new language. The Act supersedes and preempts State or local laws regulating gaming or bucket shops, excluding certain agreements or transactions. Amendments are made to various sections of the Commodity Exchange Act. Amendments are made to various sections of the Commodity Exchange Act, including changes to section 13106(b)(1) of the Food, Conservation, and Energy Act of 2008.
